   1  """ 
   2  Tab art provider code - a tab provider provides all drawing functionality to 
   3  the :class:`~lib.agw.aui.auibook.AuiNotebook`. This allows the 
   4  :class:`~lib.agw.aui.auibook.AuiNotebook` to have a plugable look-and-feel. 
   5   
   6  By default, a :class:`~lib.agw.aui.auibook.AuiNotebook` uses an instance of this class 
   7  called :class:`AuiDefaultTabArt` which provides bitmap art and a colour scheme that is 
   8  adapted to the major platforms' look. You can either derive from that class to alter its 
   9  behaviour or write a completely new tab art class. 
  10  Call :meth:`AuiNotebook.SetArtProvider() <lib.agw.aui.auibook.AuiNotebook.SetArtProvider>` 
  11  to make use this new tab art. 
  12  """ 
  13   
  14  __author__ = "Andrea Gavana <andrea.gavana@gmail.com>" 
  15  __date__ = "31 March 2009" 
  16

  47 -    def ProcessEvent(self, event): 

  48          """ 
  49          Processes an event, searching event tables and calling zero or more suitable 
  50          event handler function(s). 
  51   
  52          :param `event`: the event to process. 
  53   
  54          :note: Normally, your application would not call this function: it is called 
  55           in the wxPython implementation to dispatch incoming user interface events 
  56           to the framework (and application). 
  57           However, you might need to call it if implementing new functionality (such as 
  58           a new control) where you define new event types, as opposed to allowing the 
  59           user to override functions. 
  60   
  61           An instance where you might actually override the :meth:`ProcessEvent` function is where 
  62           you want to direct event processing to event handlers not normally noticed by 
  63           wxPython. For example, in the document/view architecture, documents and views 
  64           are potential event handlers. When an event reaches a frame, :meth:`ProcessEvent` will 
  65           need to be called on the associated document and view in case event handler 
  66           functions are associated with these objects.  
  67   
  68           The normal order of event table searching is as follows: 
  69   
  70           1. If the object is disabled (via a call to :meth:`EvtHandler.SetEvtHandlerEnabled`) the function 
  71              skips to step (6). 
  72           2. If the object is a :class:`Window`, :meth:`ProcessEvent` is recursively called on the window's  
  73              :class:`Validator`. If this returns ``True``, the function exits. 
  74           3. wxWidgets `SearchEventTable` is called for this event handler. If this fails, the 
  75              base class table is tried, and so on until no more tables exist or an appropriate 
  76              function was found, in which case the function exits. 
  77           4. The search is applied down the entire chain of event handlers (usually the chain 
  78              has a length of one). If this succeeds, the function exits. 
  79           5. If the object is a :class:`Window` and the event is a :class:`CommandEvent`, :meth:`ProcessEvent` is 
  80              recursively applied to the parent window's event handler. If this returns ``True``, 
  81              the function exits. 
  82           6. Finally, :meth:`ProcessEvent` is called on the :class:`App` object. 
  83          """ 
  84           
  85          if event.GetEventType() == wx.wxEVT_COMMAND_MENU_SELECTED: 
  86              self._last_id = event.GetId() 
  87              return True 
  88           
  89          if self.GetNextHandler(): 
  90              return self.GetNextHandler().ProcessEvent(event) 
  91   
  92          return False

 212          """ 
 213          Sets the tab art flags.

 215          :param integer `agwFlags`: a combination of the following values: 
 216   
 217           ==================================== ================================== 
 218           Flag name                            Description 
 219           ==================================== ================================== 
 220           ``AUI_NB_TOP``                       With this style, tabs are drawn along the top of the notebook 
 221           ``AUI_NB_LEFT``                      With this style, tabs are drawn along the left of the notebook. Not implemented yet. 
 222           ``AUI_NB_RIGHT``                     With this style, tabs are drawn along the right of the notebook. Not implemented yet. 
 223           ``AUI_NB_BOTTOM``                    With this style, tabs are drawn along the bottom of the notebook 
 224           ``AUI_NB_TAB_SPLIT``                 Allows the tab control to be split by dragging a tab 
 225           ``AUI_NB_TAB_MOVE``                  Allows a tab to be moved horizontally by dragging 
 226           ``AUI_NB_TAB_EXTERNAL_MOVE``         Allows a tab to be moved to another tab control 
 227           ``AUI_NB_TAB_FIXED_WIDTH``           With this style, all tabs have the same width 
 228           ``AUI_NB_SCROLL_BUTTONS``            With this style, left and right scroll buttons are displayed 
 229           ``AUI_NB_WINDOWLIST_BUTTON``         With this style, a drop-down list of windows is available 
 230           ``AUI_NB_CLOSE_BUTTON``              With this style, a close button is available on the tab bar 
 231           ``AUI_NB_CLOSE_ON_ACTIVE_TAB``       With this style, a close button is available on the active tab 
 232           ``AUI_NB_CLOSE_ON_ALL_TABS``         With this style, a close button is available on all tabs 
 233           ``AUI_NB_MIDDLE_CLICK_CLOSE``        Allows to close :class:`~lib.agw.aui.auibook.AuiNotebook` tabs by mouse middle button click 
 234           ``AUI_NB_SUB_NOTEBOOK``              This style is used by :class:`~lib.agw.aui.framemanager.AuiManager` to create automatic AuiNotebooks 
 235           ``AUI_NB_HIDE_ON_SINGLE_TAB``        Hides the tab window if only one tab is present 
 236           ``AUI_NB_SMART_TABS``                Use Smart Tabbing, like ``Alt`` + ``Tab`` on Windows 
 237           ``AUI_NB_USE_IMAGES_DROPDOWN``       Uses images on dropdown window list menu instead of check items 
 238           ``AUI_NB_CLOSE_ON_TAB_LEFT``         Draws the tab close button on the left instead of on the right (a la Camino browser) 
 239           ``AUI_NB_TAB_FLOAT``                 Allows the floating of single tabs. Known limitation: when the notebook is more or less 
 240                                                full screen, tabs cannot be dragged far enough outside of the notebook to become floating pages 
 241           ``AUI_NB_DRAW_DND_TAB``              Draws an image representation of a tab while dragging (on by default) 
 242           ``AUI_NB_ORDER_BY_ACCESS``           Tab navigation order by last access time for the tabs 
 243           ``AUI_NB_NO_TAB_FOCUS``              Don't draw tab focus rectangle 
 244           ==================================== ================================== 
 245           
 246          """

 248          self._agwFlags = agwFlags

 261 -    def SetSizingInfo(self, tab_ctrl_size, tab_count, minMaxTabWidth): 

 262          """ 
 263          Sets the tab sizing information. 
 264           
 265          :param Size `tab_ctrl_size`: the size of the tab control area; 
 266          :param integer `tab_count`: the number of tabs; 
 267          :param tuple `minMaxTabWidth`: a tuple containing the minimum and maximum tab widths 
 268           to be used when the ``AUI_NB_TAB_FIXED_WIDTH`` style is active. 
 269          """ 
 270           
 271          self._fixed_tab_width = 100 
 272          minTabWidth, maxTabWidth = minMaxTabWidth 
 273   
 274          tot_width = tab_ctrl_size.x - self.GetIndentSize() - 4 
 275          agwFlags = self.GetAGWFlags() 
 276           
 277          if agwFlags & AUI_NB_CLOSE_BUTTON: 
 278              tot_width -= self._active_close_bmp.GetWidth() 
 279          if agwFlags & AUI_NB_WINDOWLIST_BUTTON: 
 280              tot_width -= self._active_windowlist_bmp.GetWidth() 
 281   
 282          if tab_count > 0: 
 283              self._fixed_tab_width = tot_width/tab_count 
 284   
 285          if self._fixed_tab_width < 100: 
 286              self._fixed_tab_width = 100 
 287   
 288          if self._fixed_tab_width > tot_width/2: 
 289              self._fixed_tab_width = tot_width/2 
 290   
 291          if self._fixed_tab_width > 220: 
 292              self._fixed_tab_width = 220 
 293   
 294          if minTabWidth > -1: 
 295              self._fixed_tab_width = max(self._fixed_tab_width, minTabWidth) 
 296          if maxTabWidth > -1: 
 297              self._fixed_tab_width = min(self._fixed_tab_width, maxTabWidth) 
 298   
 299          self._tab_ctrl_height = tab_ctrl_size.y

 343 -    def DrawTab(self, dc, wnd, page, in_rect, close_button_state, paint_control=False): 

 344          """ 
 345          Draws a single tab. 
 346   
 347          :param `dc`: a :class:`DC` device context; 
 348          :param `wnd`: a :class:`Window` instance object; 
 349          :param `page`: the tab control page associated with the tab; 
 350          :param Rect `in_rect`: rectangle the tab should be confined to; 
 351          :param integer `close_button_state`: the state of the close button on the tab; 
 352          :param bool `paint_control`: whether to draw the control inside a tab (if any) on a :class:`MemoryDC`. 
 353          """ 
 354   
 355          # if the caption is empty, measure some temporary text 
 356          caption = page.caption 
 357          if not caption: 
 358              caption = "Xj" 
 359   
 360          dc.SetFont(self._selected_font) 
 361          selected_textx, selected_texty, dummy = dc.GetMultiLineTextExtent(caption) 
 362   
 363          dc.SetFont(self._normal_font) 
 364          normal_textx, normal_texty, dummy = dc.GetMultiLineTextExtent(caption) 
 365   
 366          control = page.control 
 367   
 368          # figure out the size of the tab 
 369          tab_size, x_extent = self.GetTabSize(dc, wnd, page.caption, page.bitmap, 
 370                                               page.active, close_button_state, control) 
 371   
 372          tab_height = self._tab_ctrl_height - 3 
 373          tab_width = tab_size[0] 
 374          tab_x = in_rect.x 
 375          tab_y = in_rect.y + in_rect.height - tab_height 
 376   
 377          caption = page.caption 
 378   
 379          # select pen, brush and font for the tab to be drawn 
 380   
 381          if page.active: 
 382           
 383              dc.SetFont(self._selected_font) 
 384              textx, texty = selected_textx, selected_texty 
 385           
 386          else: 
 387           
 388              dc.SetFont(self._normal_font) 
 389              textx, texty = normal_textx, normal_texty 
 390   
 391          if not page.enabled: 
 392              dc.SetTextForeground(self._tab_disabled_text_colour) 
 393              pagebitmap = page.dis_bitmap 
 394          else: 
 395              dc.SetTextForeground(self._tab_text_colour(page)) 
 396              pagebitmap = page.bitmap 
 397               
 398          # create points that will make the tab outline 
 399   
 400          clip_width = tab_width 
 401          if tab_x + clip_width > in_rect.x + in_rect.width: 
 402              clip_width = in_rect.x + in_rect.width - tab_x 
 403   
 404          # since the above code above doesn't play well with WXDFB or WXCOCOA, 
 405          # we'll just use a rectangle for the clipping region for now -- 
 406          dc.SetClippingRegion(tab_x, tab_y, clip_width+1, tab_height-3) 
 407   
 408          border_points = [wx.Point() for i in xrange(6)] 
 409          agwFlags = self.GetAGWFlags() 
 410           
 411          if agwFlags & AUI_NB_BOTTOM: 
 412           
 413              border_points[0] = wx.Point(tab_x,             tab_y) 
 414              border_points[1] = wx.Point(tab_x,             tab_y+tab_height-6) 
 415              border_points[2] = wx.Point(tab_x+2,           tab_y+tab_height-4) 
 416              border_points[3] = wx.Point(tab_x+tab_width-2, tab_y+tab_height-4) 
 417              border_points[4] = wx.Point(tab_x+tab_width,   tab_y+tab_height-6) 
 418              border_points[5] = wx.Point(tab_x+tab_width,   tab_y) 
 419           
 420          else: #if (agwFlags & AUI_NB_TOP)  
 421           
 422              border_points[0] = wx.Point(tab_x,             tab_y+tab_height-4) 
 423              border_points[1] = wx.Point(tab_x,             tab_y+2) 
 424              border_points[2] = wx.Point(tab_x+2,           tab_y) 
 425              border_points[3] = wx.Point(tab_x+tab_width-2, tab_y) 
 426              border_points[4] = wx.Point(tab_x+tab_width,   tab_y+2) 
 427              border_points[5] = wx.Point(tab_x+tab_width,   tab_y+tab_height-4) 
 428           
 429          # TODO: else if (agwFlags & AUI_NB_LEFT)  
 430          # TODO: else if (agwFlags & AUI_NB_RIGHT)  
 431   
 432          drawn_tab_yoff = border_points[1].y 
 433          drawn_tab_height = border_points[0].y - border_points[1].y 
 434   
 435          if page.active: 
 436           
 437              # draw active tab 
 438   
 439              # draw base background colour 
 440              r = wx.Rect(tab_x, tab_y, tab_width, tab_height) 
 441              dc.SetPen(self._base_colour_pen) 
 442              dc.SetBrush(self._base_colour_brush) 
 443              dc.DrawRectangle(r.x+1, r.y+1, r.width-1, r.height-4) 
 444   
 445              # this white helps fill out the gradient at the top of the tab 
 446              dc.SetPen( wx.Pen(self._tab_gradient_highlight_colour) ) 
 447              dc.SetBrush( wx.Brush(self._tab_gradient_highlight_colour) ) 
 448              dc.DrawRectangle(r.x+2, r.y+1, r.width-3, r.height-4) 
 449   
 450              # these two points help the rounded corners appear more antialiased 
 451              dc.SetPen(self._base_colour_pen) 
 452              dc.DrawPoint(r.x+2, r.y+1) 
 453              dc.DrawPoint(r.x+r.width-2, r.y+1) 
 454   
 455              # set rectangle down a bit for gradient drawing 
 456              r.SetHeight(r.GetHeight()/2) 
 457              r.x += 2 
 458              r.width -= 2 
 459              r.y += r.height 
 460              r.y -= 2 
 461   
 462              # draw gradient background 
 463              top_colour = self._tab_bottom_colour 
 464              bottom_colour = self._tab_top_colour 
 465              dc.GradientFillLinear(r, bottom_colour, top_colour, wx.NORTH) 
 466           
 467          else: 
 468           
 469              # draw inactive tab 
 470   
 471              r = wx.Rect(tab_x, tab_y+1, tab_width, tab_height-3) 
 472   
 473              # start the gradent up a bit and leave the inside border inset 
 474              # by a pixel for a 3D look.  Only the top half of the inactive 
 475              # tab will have a slight gradient 
 476              r.x += 3 
 477              r.y += 1 
 478              r.width -= 4 
 479              r.height /= 2 
 480              r.height -= 1 
 481   
 482              # -- draw top gradient fill for glossy look 
 483              top_colour = self._tab_inactive_top_colour 
 484              bottom_colour = self._tab_inactive_bottom_colour 
 485              dc.GradientFillLinear(r, bottom_colour, top_colour, wx.NORTH) 
 486   
 487              r.y += r.height 
 488              r.y -= 1 
 489   
 490              # -- draw bottom fill for glossy look 
 491              top_colour = self._tab_inactive_bottom_colour 
 492              bottom_colour = self._tab_inactive_bottom_colour 
 493              dc.GradientFillLinear(r, top_colour, bottom_colour, wx.SOUTH) 
 494           
 495          # draw tab outline 
 496          dc.SetPen(self._border_pen) 
 497          dc.SetBrush(wx.TRANSPARENT_BRUSH) 
 498          dc.DrawPolygon(border_points) 
 499   
 500          # there are two horizontal grey lines at the bottom of the tab control, 
 501          # this gets rid of the top one of those lines in the tab control 
 502          if page.active: 
 503           
 504              if agwFlags & AUI_NB_BOTTOM: 
 505                  dc.SetPen(wx.Pen(self._background_bottom_colour)) 
 506                   
 507              # TODO: else if (agwFlags & AUI_NB_LEFT)  
 508              # TODO: else if (agwFlags & AUI_NB_RIGHT)  
 509              else: # for AUI_NB_TOP 
 510                  dc.SetPen(self._base_colour_pen) 
 511                   
 512              dc.DrawLine(border_points[0].x+1, 
 513                          border_points[0].y, 
 514                          border_points[5].x, 
 515                          border_points[5].y) 
 516           
 517          text_offset = tab_x + 8 
 518          close_button_width = 0 
 519   
 520          if close_button_state != AUI_BUTTON_STATE_HIDDEN: 
 521              close_button_width = self._active_close_bmp.GetWidth() 
 522   
 523              if agwFlags & AUI_NB_CLOSE_ON_TAB_LEFT: 
 524                  text_offset += close_button_width - 5 
 525                   
 526          bitmap_offset = 0 
 527           
 528          if pagebitmap.IsOk(): 
 529           
 530              bitmap_offset = tab_x + 8 
 531              if agwFlags & AUI_NB_CLOSE_ON_TAB_LEFT and close_button_width: 
 532                  bitmap_offset += close_button_width - 5 
 533   
 534              # draw bitmap 
 535              dc.DrawBitmap(pagebitmap, 
 536                            bitmap_offset, 
 537                            drawn_tab_yoff + (drawn_tab_height/2) - (pagebitmap.GetHeight()/2), 
 538                            True) 
 539   
 540              text_offset = bitmap_offset + pagebitmap.GetWidth() 
 541              text_offset += 3 # bitmap padding 
 542   
 543          else: 
 544

2767                  rect = wx.Rect(tab_x + tab_width - close_button_width - rightw + 2, 
2768                                 drawn_tab_yoff + (drawn_tab_height / 2) - (bmp.GetHeight() / 2) + 1, 
2769                                 close_button_width, tab_height) 
2770   
2771              if agwFlags & AUI_NB_BOTTOM: 
2772                  rect.y -= 1 
2773                   
2774              # Indent the button if it is pressed down: 
2775              rect = IndentPressedBitmap(rect, close_button_state) 
2776              dc.DrawBitmap(bmp, rect.x, rect.y, True) 
2777              out_button_rect = rect 
2778               
2779          out_tab_rect = wx.Rect(tab_x, tab_y, tab_width, tab_height) 
2780          dc.DestroyClippingRegion() 
2781   
2782          return out_tab_rect, out_button_rect, x_extent
